intro: Mabea taquari var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf mabea, is a species of flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, pale yellow flowers. It is often found in wetland or riparian habitats, thriving in moist environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
